message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and past medical history suggest the patient is experiencing Stevens-Johnson Syndrome (SJS) or Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis (TEN) due to a reaction to ciprofloxacin. The next best diagnostic step is a skin biopsy and histopathologic analysis to confirm the diagnosis and determine the extent of skin detachment. Indirect immunofluorescence on perilesional biopsy is used for diagnosing autoimmune bullous disorders. Blood cultures and PCR for serum staphylococcal exfoliative toxin are not relevant in this case.
